Experience Sort Probing Process and Module Equipment Engineer Intel Corporation January 2011  – Present (4 years 8 months) Hudson Massachusetts My responsibility includes: 
 
SCCB (Sort Change Control Board): Chair of the Sort and Product Change Control Board. Creator and co-approver of white papers related to process and equipment improvements. 
 
Harvest Management: Led the SORT mfg. team through a successful equipment harvest of spare parts to maintain the aging and obsolete fleet of production machines.  
 
Process Engineering:  
- Developed a wafer laser scribe recipe for new product introduction. Through experimentation determined the optimum power settings to meet the OCR SEMI standard spec. Updated process and equipment specifications and successfully completed white paper requirements and release to manufacturing..

Equipment Engineering:  
- Assumed ownership for all manufacturing modules in sort, i.e Tokyo Electron P8-prober/Schlumberger testers, Tokyo Electron P12-prober/Advantest CMT, Tokyo Electron P12-prober/ Teradyne J973 Tester and Rofin wafer laser scribe. Responsible for Mean time between failures, spare part inventory management and tool matching. Tool availability is typically > 95% based on 18 modules in production.  
- Led Equipment Specialist Day camps driving spare parts harvest plans, designing BKM's for prober calibrations, P8i and P12XL preventative measurement optimization and provided training to equipment technicians.
